Title: You want a powerful sprayer this is it.
Review: You want a powerful sprayer this is it. I've owned the typhoon 2.0 this is a huge upgrade. New straps, new hose, new gun, its wonderful product. I own a pest control company and this makes my job so much easier. Also flow zone has great customer service. If you have a issue they fix it right away. Can't go wrong with this purchase.
Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 28, 2022

Title: Awesome
Review: Love it. I do a lot of spraying for my lawn customers .. this makes the job much faster compared to hand pumping.
Date: Reviewed in the United States on December 26, 2021

Title: Top notch product
Review: I was nervous about spending the money on this sprayer. It’s expensive, but in my opinion it’s worth it. From spraying pre-emergent for my lawn, weed killers at my farm, or even using distilled water in it to rinse off my truck after washing, this thing has made my life so much easier. It does take some getting used to though. I used an entire 4 gallons on only half of my yard when using pre-emergent when my mixture was for my whole yard. That was ignorance on my part not knowing the gallons per 1000ft2. If you can afford it, it’s the best there is in my opinion.
Date: Reviewed in the United States on March 20, 2021

Title: Best Sprayer I have Ever Owned!
Review: I order the Typhoon V2 with variable pressure control.  It has been outstanding.  I have sprayed my driveway twice,  my entire outside of my house, my sidewalks and patio.  It still has three bars left on the battery.  I purchased a cart and a 20ft hose extension from another company and I had an issue with the cart and the backpack matching up.  I called FlowZone customer service and they sent  me the part to fix the problem at no charge right away.  Excellent customer service.  I even was able to spray mildew on my roof (about 26 feet up).  I love the variable pressure control.  Excellent design and if needed all parts are easily accessible.  Great product!
Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 18, 2020

Title: Bang for you buck!
Review: Really good sprayer! Great battery life. Harnest is very comfortable. Multiple handles to carry. I wish it cam with better tips & longer shaft.
Date: Reviewed in the United States on April 22, 2021

Title: Great sprayer, customer service not so much
Review: The product works great however the customer service not so much. We paid for expedited shipping but the item took almost a month to arrive. Requested a refund on the shipping thst we paid extra for and never heard from.tne company. The sprayer is awesome though, highly recommend

Title: Great tool, no regrets so far. I had to find other source to order though..
Review: This can easily empty out the entirety of it's tank in 10-15 minutes of spraying at full power. Despite shipping with the smaller battery this leaves you with a considerable amount of useful life in one charge to tackle large areas of your yard.Persons who deal with a bigger yard than mine ought to consider the 9 gallon version that is on wheels.I ran 10 gallons through the typhoon 2.5 and it still has a lot of battery left before I need to plug it in again.Straps on this are definitely well thought out, and padding is nice, I hear it's extra padded over the old one.I have plenty of reach with the stream shooting out 10-15 feet with various tips, full unrestricted output I estimate to be 20-25 feet.If you can call it that, there is no way this provides 60 psi or anything close to it. I would say this does about 20-30 psi at full output which is plenty.If you don't like the gun it has, I can't imagine who wouldn't, you can always swap it to a more traditional gun/wand that professional exterminators use.It does arrive partially discharged so charge it prior to use, charging took 40 minutes, easy peesy!
Date: Reviewed in the United States on June 30, 2021

Title: Leaks
Review: This is a great backpack sprayer for the money but it cracked somehow inside and now it has a leak that I cannot patch. I’ve owned this since June and my coworker also has a leak as well. We cannot find where it leaks from.
Date: Reviewed in the United States on September 25, 2020
